body_html:
I agree with @albertz . Queues have one important feature -- it can take data from Python side and that's important for a lot of use cases where data cannot be easily preprocessed with TF operators. Also it's much easier to write for anyone.
Therefore dataset API at least today doesn't seem to be strong enough to replace Queues. I still hope to see some methods to close & reopen the queue.

body:
I agree with @albertz . Queues have one important feature -- it can take data from Python side and that's important for a lot of use cases where data cannot be easily preprocessed with TF operators. Also it's much easier to write for anyone.
Therefore dataset API at least today doesn't seem to be strong enough to replace Queues. I still hope to see some methods to close & reopen the queue.
